bug.author: dan-ryan
bug.summary: Moved: NEAT breaks with provenance with if no template network is provided
bug.description:
This bug has been moved from Neataptic. <denchmark-link:https://github.com/wagenaartje/neataptic/issues/145>wagenaartje/neataptic#145</denchmark-link>
While createPool() gracefully handles the no-template case, provenance doesn't. You could simply set the default network (new Network(this.input, this.output)) when none is provided and simplify createPool()

comments.comment: @christianechevarria added one code comment. It's minor so you can ignore it.
